title: The White Tiger
author: Aravind Adiga
description: Balram Halwai, a village boy, thwarts all the obstacles that poverty and corruption put in his path to become a successful entrepreneur in Bangalore. The novel explores issues of religion, caste, loyalty, and corruption in India.

title: The God of Small Things
author: Arundhati Roy
description: This Booker Prize-winning novel explores how small things affect people's behavior and their lives. It's the story of twins Rahel and Estha growing up in Kerala, India, amidst political turbulence.

title: Midnight's Children
author: Salman Rushdie
description: Born at the stroke of midnight on August 15, 1947, at the precise moment of India's independence, Saleem Sinai is mysteriously bound to his nation's fate. Saleem's life parallels the history of his nation.

title: A Suitable Boy
author: Vikram Seth
description: Set in post-independence India, this epic novel follows four families over a period of 18 months as Mrs. Rupa Mehra searches for a suitable boy for her daughter, Lata.

title: The Namesake
author: Jhumpa Lahiri
description: The novel follows the life of Gogol Ganguli from birth to adulthood, chronicling his struggle to reconcile his Indian heritage with his American upbringing.

title: Train to Pakistan
author: Khushwant Singh
description: This novel describes the 1947 Partition of India through the perspective of Mano Majra, a fictional border village. It portrays the human tragedy that unfolded during this tumultuous time.

title: The Palace of Illusions
author: Chitra Banerjee Divakaruni
description: A reimagining of the ancient Indian epic Mahabharata from the perspective of Panchaali, the wife of the five Pandava brothers, giving voice to this female character in a traditionally male-centered story.

title: The Inheritance of Loss
author: Kiran Desai
description: Set in India and New York, this novel examines the consequences of colonialism and the issues of globalization through the lives of various characters, including a retired judge, his granddaughter, and their cook's son.

title: The Guide
author: R.K. Narayan
description: This novel follows the life of Raju, a tour guide who becomes a spiritual guide and ultimately a revered holy man. It's a tale of transformation, deception, and redemption set against the backdrop of Malgudi.

title: The Shadow Lines
author: Amitav Ghosh
description: This novel explores the consequences of drawing political boundaries between nations and how they affect the relationships between people. It follows the lives of families in Calcutta and London over multiple generations.

title: The Immortals of Meluha
author: Amish Tripathi
description: The first book in the Shiva Trilogy, this novel reimagines the Hindu deity Shiva as a Tibetan tribal chief who is invited to the advanced civilization of Meluha where he battles evil forces.

title: Shantaram
author: Gregory David Roberts
description: Based on the author's own life, this novel follows the journey of an Australian bank robber and heroin addict who escapes from prison and flees to Bombay (Mumbai), where he finds a new life in the city's underworld.

title: Sacred Games
author: Vikram Chandra
description: This epic crime novel explores the connections between organized crime, politics, and the entertainment industry in contemporary Mumbai through the lives of a police officer and a gangster.

title: The Lives of Others
author: Neel Mukherjee
description: Set in 1960s Calcutta, this novel explores the lives of the Ghosh family, whose members are engaged in various forms of social and political struggle amidst the backdrop of the Naxalite movement.

title: The Blue Umbrella
author: Ruskin Bond
description: This children's novella tells the story of Binya, a poor girl living in a village in the Himalayan foothills, who trades her lucky leopard's claw necklace for a beautiful blue umbrella, leading to jealousy and eventual redemption.

title: The Room on the Roof
author: Ruskin Bond
description: This semi-autobiographical novel follows Rusty, an orphaned Anglo-Indian boy who runs away from his strict guardian to live with his Indian friends, capturing the joy, wonder, and confusion of adolescence in small-town India.

title: Malgudi Days
author: R.K. Narayan
description: A collection of 32 short stories set in the fictional South Indian town of Malgudi, these tales capture the essence of everyday life in India, with all its joys, sorrows, quirks, and complexities.

title: The Ministry of Utmost Happiness
author: Arundhati Roy
description: This novel weaves together the lives of many characters, including a transgender woman living in a graveyard and a woman who adopts an abandoned baby, against the backdrop of contemporary India's social and political landscape.

title: English, August: An Indian Story
author: Upamanyu Chatterjee
description: This novel follows Agastya Sen, a young civil servant who is posted to a small town in central India, where he struggles with boredom, alienation, and his own identity as he navigates the absurdities of bureaucratic life.

title: Interpreter of Maladies
author: Jhumpa Lahiri
description: This Pulitzer Prize-winning collection of nine short stories explores the lives of Indian and Indian-American characters navigating the complexities of love, family, and cultural identity across borders.

title: Maximum City: Bombay Lost and Found
author: Suketu Mehta
description: Part travelogue, part memoir, part journalism, this non-fiction work explores the city of Mumbai (Bombay) through its underworld gangsters, Bollywood stars, bar dancers, religious fundamentalists, and ordinary citizens.

title: A Fine Balance
author: Rohinton Mistry
description: Set during the Emergency period in India (1975-1977), this novel follows four characters from different backgrounds whose lives intersect in a small apartment, highlighting the resilience of the human spirit amidst political upheaval.

title: The Glass Palace
author: Amitav Ghosh
description: This historical novel follows the intertwined destinies of families across generations in Burma (Myanmar), India, and Malaya, spanning more than a century, from the fall of the Burmese monarchy to the modern era.

title: Fasting, Feasting
author: Anita Desai
description: This novel contrasts the lives of Uma, a spinster daughter in a traditional Indian household, and her brother Arun, who studies in Massachusetts, exploring themes of family dynamics, gender roles, and cultural differences.

title: The Lowland
author: Jhumpa Lahiri
description: This novel follows two brothers born in Calcutta who follow divergent paths—one becomes a political revolutionary, while the other pursues scientific research in America. Their choices have profound consequences for their family across generations.
